thread.title: Downton Abbey goes all Game of Thrones and Walking Dead with gory dinner scene
thread.title_full: Downton Abbey goes all Game of Thrones and Walking Dead with gory dinner scene

author: Ebony Bowden
title: Downton Abbey goes all Game of Thrones and Walking Dead with gory dinner scene
text:
Downton Abbey 's episode on Sunday night was compared to something out of The Exorcist . 
Downton Abbey to get a movie makeover? Why viewers are mad about Downton Abbey SPOILERS  
Clever Downton Abbey fans thought they knew what awaited them when British broadcaster ITV warned Sunday's episode would contain "shocking scenes".
We need to talk about what happened to Robert Crawley on Downton Abbey last night. 
The British period drama which follows the trials and tribulations of the wealthy Crawley family is more known for back-stabbing aristocrats than violent and disturbing scenes.
Advertisement Many feared one of their beloved characters would die or be shockingly killed mid-episode.
You can imagine fans' surprise then, when family patriarch Lord Crawley proceeded to spray blood over his entire family and collapse on the floor during a dinner party.
Woah, what happened on Downton Abbey last night? Photo: ITV 
The gory scene, compared to something out of The Exorcist or zombie drama The Walking Dead , comes after Lord Crawley's diagnosis last season with a stomach ulcer, which exploded during Sunday's episode.
Disturbed Downton Abbey fans compared it to the dinner party bloodbath in Game of Thrones ' infamous Red Wedding episode, while others said it made The Walking Dead look like "My Little Pony".
"Didn't realise Downton had been taken over by Quentin Tarantino mid-episode" one fan said on Twitter.
Wrote another: "Not entirely sure if I'm watching Alien or Downton Abbey ".
Despite essentially exploding, Lord Crawley, Earl of Grantham, is taken to hospital and survives for another day.
Making fun of the show's stiff 1900s England drama, Antiques Roadshow  expert Steven Moore wrote: "I know Downton Abbey said to be prepared for 'shocking scenes' but I wasn't quite prepared for a chamber maid speaking frankly to a doctor!"
The British drama is drawing to a close after six seasons, with the final episode set to air later this year.
Many speculate Lord Crawley will not make it to the end of the show, with his eldest daughter Mary being groomed to take over the estate.
Well, someone's gonna die for sure in Downton Abbey with all these "shocking scenes" warnings
— Mairéad (@themaireadio) October 18, 2015 wtf just happened on downton abbey i am bliND
— emily | 10 (@lwtfires) October 18, 2015 Didn't realised Downton had been taken over by Quentin Tarantino mid-episode, jesus #downtonabbey 
— elly (@quietbatpeople) October 18, 2015 Great seeing Hugh Bonneville paying homage to John Hurt's Alien scene last night. #Downton 
— Richard Nutman (@RichardN7) October 19, 2015 #Downton pic.twitter.com/nsDRMCIlXI 
— Abi Paterson (@abipaterson) October 18, 2015 I know #DowntonAbbey said to be prepared for "shocking scenes" but I wasn't quite prepared for a chamber maid speaking frankly to a doctor!
— Steven Moore (@MrStevenMoore) October 18, 2015 Downton Abbey just made The Walking Dead look like My Little Pony...
— Maria Vincent (@mariajvincent) October 18, 2015 wtf I was just chilling and Downton abbey was on in the background and the guy just exploded
— emily (@perfectlyelyar) October 18, 2015 since when has downton abbey been this emotionally traumatising
— Anna McKie (@_annamckie_) October 18, 2015 Not entirely sure if I'm watching Alien or Downton Abbey... #Downton 
— Cath Poucher (@CathPoucher) October 18, 2015 Downtown Abbey 's final season is set to air on Seven in 2016.
